de.thkoeln.bibl.api.rfid.reader

Class Reader<T extends BaseTag>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.thkoeln.bibl.api.rfid.reader.Reader<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of tags the reader can handle
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ThreadedReader

    public abstract class Reader<T extends BaseTag>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class implements common functionality of a RFID reader. Specializing sub-classes must implement the abstract parts of this class. A reader can signal scan related events to registered listeners. Added tags were transparently stored for later offline access. the whole tag-data is stored in an hash-map for fast access and to guaranty only unique stored tags.
    Author:
    Patrick Rogalla

      • addTag

        protected T addTag(java.lang.String uid,
                   de.feig.FedmTableItem item)
            throws TagException
        Add a tag to the internal map. The tag will internally created with the supplied table item.
        Parameters:
        uid - the UID to map the tag to
        item - the table item from which the tag will be created
        Returns:
        the created tag that was added to the internal map
        Throws:
        TagException - if the internal tag creation failed

      • containsTag

        public boolean containsTag(java.lang.String uid)
        Checks if the reader has a tag stored in the internal map which is mapped to the supplied UID.
        Parameters:
        uid - the UID to check if a tag is mapped to
        Returns:
        true if a tag exists that is mapped to the supplied UID

      • containsTag

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the tag exists in the internal map

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        Clear the internal tag map.

      • start

        public abstract void start()
        Starts the reader and tag detection. After starting the reader, the event reporting automatically reports to registered listeners.

      • stop

        public abstract void stop()
        Stops the reader and tag detection.
